job_title: Junior Full Stack Developer (Part-time, Student Only)
job_description:
**MUST BE A REGISTERED STUDENT FOR WINTER 2026**

About the Role

Stellari is hiring a Junior Full Stack Developer to support the development of Koru, a modern web application focused on event experiences, real-time interactions, and social matching. This is a student friendly role designed to provide meaningful experience in full stack development, cloud technologies, and agile workflows while allowing for flexible scheduling during the academic year.

You will work primarily remotely with guidance and mentorship from an experienced professional software engineer. The role involves contributing directly to the MVP build of a real production application.

Responsibilities

Full Stack Development

Build user interfaces using JavaScript, React, and Tailwind CSS
Work with TypeScript for more advanced front-end and back-end tasks
Develop and maintain API routes and server logic using Node.js
Assist with data modeling, database queries, and storage design
Implement authentication flows and user onboarding features
Contribute to reusable components and UI patterns
Help improve overall product usability and experience

Cloud and Infrastructure (asset, not required)

Work with AWS or similar platforms for API hosting or storage
Contribute to basic deployment tasks
Participate in logging and debugging workflows

Agile Workflow

Use GitHub for version control and pull requests
Work from a Kanban board to manage tasks and project priorities
Join short online check-ins and planning meetings
Contribute to documentation for features and technical decisions

Required Skills

Knowledge of JavaScript
Experience with React
Basic understanding of TypeScript or a willingness to learn
Familiarity with front-end development concepts
Interest in back-end logic and building complete feature flows
Good problem solving skills
Ability to work independently in a remote environment

Assets

Tailwind CSS
Node.js
AWS or similar cloud experience
Experience with authentication concepts such as JWT
Familiarity with SQL or NoSQL databases
UI or UX design interest
Prior exposure to Agile or Kanban practices

Ideal Candidate

Currently studying computer science, software engineering, or a related field
Looking for practical development experience for their resume
Comfortable learning new tools and technologies
Responsible, organized, and able to communicate well in a remote setting
Interested in contributing to the early stages of a new software product

Term and Growth Opportunities

January to the end of April
Possible extension for an additional 4 to 8 months
Potential full-time role available upon graduation

Why Join Us

Flexible hours to support school schedules
Mostly remote work arrangement
Direct mentorship from an industry engineer
Opportunity to build real features for a production MVP
Fast learning environment with exposure to full stack development
Friendly and supportive team culture

Equal Opportunity Employer

Stellari welcomes applicants from all backgrounds, including women in STEM, new Canadians, and students from groups underrepresented in technology. Selection is based solely on qualifications, attitude, and interest in the role.

Job Types: Part-time, Fixed term contract, Apprenticeship, Internship / Co-op
Contract length: 16 weeks

Pay: $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 25 per week

Benefits:

Flexible schedule
Work from home

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Edmonton, AB
